title: Strangulation
data:
**Strangulation** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that induces a [delayed instadeath](/wiki/Delayed_instadeath "Delayed instadeath") by choking.

The only source of the property is [wearing](/wiki/Wear "Wear") an [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Messages](#Messages)
  - [2.1 Turns to live](#Turns_to_live)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [3.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [4 References](#References)

## Description

Strangulation abuses the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), impedes their ability to breathe and will kill them in six turns. While being strangled, a hero cannot performing several actions that require breathing: they are unable to [quaff](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff"), operate [whistles](/wiki/Whistle "Whistle") or other similar [instruments](/wiki/Instrument "Instrument"), [read](/wiki/Read "Read") [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") while [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), or cast [spells](/wiki/Spells "Spells").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Monster polyforms that either lack a [head](/wiki/Head "Head") or are both [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless") and [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") cannot be strangled[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) - breathlessness alone will not protect the hero, since the only source of the property also stops blood flow to their brain.

## Messages

- If you can't breathe air, how can you drink liquid?

  You attempted to quaff while being strangled.

- You are being strangled.

  You are being strangled by wearing an amulet of strangulation, as viewed via [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment").

### Turns to live

The messages below correspond to the amount of turns you have left to live in the *Alt. message* column occur when you are [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless"), and 1⁄50 of the time otherwise.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

| Message                        | Alt. message                                        | Turns left to live |
| ------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------- | ------------------ |
| "It constricts your throat!"   | "It constricts your throat!"                        | 5                  |
| "You find it hard to breathe." | "Your neck is becoming constricted."                | 4                  |
| "You're gasping for air."      | "Your blood is having trouble reaching your brain." | 3                  |
| "You can no longer breathe."   | "The pressure on your neck increases."              | 2                  |
| "You're turning blue."         | "Your consciousness is fading."                     | 1                  |
| "You suffocate."               | "You suffocate."                                    | 0                  |

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the poisonous passive attack of [disgusting molds](/wiki/Disgusting_mold "Disgusting mold") and [black molds](/wiki/Black_mold_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black mold (SLASH'EM)") have no effect on a hero being strangled.

Gaining invulnerability from a [potion of invulnerability](/wiki/Potion_of_invulnerability "Potion of invulnerability") does not prevent death from strangulation.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), being engulfed by a [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") or [water elemental](/wiki/Water_elemental "Water elemental") causes strangulation that kills you in three turns.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), strangulation is handled entirely differently: Your character has a breath timer for various purposes, where the timer is set to a maximum amount of turns equal to your [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") divided by 3, and being strangled or otherwise robbed of air decrements the breath timer by 1 per turn until you can breathe again, usually by removing or stopping the cause of air loss. While you can breath normally, the breath timer regenerates at a rate of 1 per turn until full. This means that strangulation is not guaranteed to be fatal, but is far more dangerous if it occurs while you have a low enough breath timer.

Eating an amulet of strangulation in particular will not instantly kill you, but instead causes six turns of strangulation - this will result in your death if your breath timer is currently six turns or lower, unless you cure the strangulation. In addition, [choking](/wiki/Choking "Choking") on [food](/wiki/Food "Food") also causes strangulation rather than instantly killing you. Successfully praying can cure strangulation from choking, while obtaining the breathless property (e.g. via an unbreathing polyform) ignores strangulation and allows it to time out harmlessly.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), gelatinous cubes, water elementals and [sea dragons](/index.php?title=Sea_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sea dragon (page does not exist)") have an engulfing attack that causes strangulation as in GruntHack, and kills the hero in four turns as opposed to three.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 336](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.c#L336): *`can_blow` function*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 350](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.c#L350): *`can_chant` function*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 493](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L493)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 362](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.c#L362): *`can_be_strangled` function*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 257](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/timeout.c#L257)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Strangulation

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Strangulation is a property in NetHack that induces a delayed instadeath by choking.

The only source of the property is wearing an amulet of strangulation.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Messages
    • 2.1 Turns to live
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 GruntHack
    • 3.3 dNetHack
    • 3.4 EvilHack
  • 4 References

Description

Strangulation abuses the hero's strength, impedes their ability to breathe and will kill them in six turns. While being strangled, a hero cannot performing several actions that require breathing: they are unable to quaff, operate whistles or other similar instruments, read scrolls while blind, or cast spells.[1][2][3]

Monster polyforms that either lack a head or are both breathless and mindless cannot be strangled[4] - breathlessness alone will not protect the hero, since the only source of the property also stops blood flow to their brain.

Messages

If you can't breathe air, how can you drink liquid?
You attempted to quaff while being strangled.
You are being strangled.
You are being strangled by wearing an amulet of strangulation, as viewed via enlightenment.

Turns to live

The messages below correspond to the amount of turns you have left to live in the Alt. message column occur when you are breathless, and 1⁄50 of the time otherwise.[5]

Message Alt. message Turns left to live
"It constricts your throat!" "It constricts your throat!" 5
"You find it hard to breathe." "Your neck is becoming constricted." 4
"You're gasping for air." "Your blood is having trouble reaching your brain." 3
"You can no longer breathe." "The pressure on your neck increases." 2
"You're turning blue." "Your consciousness is fading." 1
"You suffocate." "You suffocate." 0

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the poisonous passive attack of disgusting molds and black molds have no effect on a hero being strangled.

Gaining invulnerability from a potion of invulnerability does not prevent death from strangulation.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, being engulfed by a gelatinous cube or water elemental causes strangulation that kills you in three turns.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, strangulation is handled entirely differently: Your character has a breath timer for various purposes, where the timer is set to a maximum amount of turns equal to your constitution divided by 3, and being strangled or otherwise robbed of air decrements the breath timer by 1 per turn until you can breathe again, usually by removing or stopping the cause of air loss. While you can breath normally, the breath timer regenerates at a rate of 1 per turn until full. This means that strangulation is not guaranteed to be fatal, but is far more dangerous if it occurs while you have a low enough breath timer.

Eating an amulet of strangulation in particular will not instantly kill you, but instead causes six turns of strangulation - this will result in your death if your breath timer is currently six turns or lower, unless you cure the strangulation. In addition, choking on food also causes strangulation rather than instantly killing you. Successfully praying can cure strangulation from choking, while obtaining the breathless property (e.g. via an unbreathing polyform) ignores strangulation and allows it to time out harmlessly.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, gelatinous cubes, water elementals and sea dragons have an engulfing attack that causes strangulation as in GruntHack, and kills the hero in four turns as opposed to three.

References

  1. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 336: can_blow function
  2. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 350: can_chant function
  3. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 493
  4. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 362: can_be_strangled function
  5. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 257

The only source of the property is [[wear]]ing an [[amulet of strangulation]]. ==Description== Strangulation abuses the [[hero]]'s [[strength]], impedes their ability to breathe and will kill them in six turns. While you can breath normally, the breath timer regenerates at a rate of 1 per turn until full. This means that strangulation is not guaranteed to be fatal, but is far more dangerous if it occurs while you have a low enough breath timer. Eating an amulet of strangulation in particular will not instantly kill you, but instead causes six turns of strangulation - this will result in your death if your breath timer is currently six turns or lower, unless you cure the strangulation. In addition, [[choking]] on [[food]] also causes strangulation rather than instantly killing you. Successfully praying can cure strangulation from choking, while obtaining the breathless property (e.g. via an unbreathing polyform) ignores strangulation and allows it to time out harmlessly. ===EvilHack=== In [[EvilHack]], gelatinous cubes, water elementals and [[sea dragon]]s have an engulfing attack that causes strangulation as in GruntHack, and kills the hero in four turns as opposed to three. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Properties]]
